GameDBLocalizedString.Text: Memantine is a medication used to treat moderate-to-severe Alzheimer's disease.

Supportive psychotherapy is a psychotherapeutic approach that integrates various schools to provide therapeutic support. It includes components from therapeutic schools such as psychodynamic, cognitive-behavioral, and interpersonal conceptual models and techniques.
Palliative care is an interdisciplinary medical caregiving approach aimed at optimizing quality of life and mitigating suffering among people with serious, complex illness.
Sedatives are a type of prescription medication that slows down brain activity. They're typically used to induce a relaxed effect.
Speech and language therapy techniques are used to improve communication. These include articulation therapy, language intervention activities, and others.
Nuedexta is used to treat involuntary outbursts of crying or laughing in people with certain neurological disorders.
